sections.heading: Preemption
sections.text: 681.116 Preemption.—This chapter preempts any similar county or municipal ordinance regarding consumer warranty rights resulting from the acquisition of a motor vehicle in this state.

sections.heading: Definitions. As used in this chapter, the term:(1)“Authorized service agent” means any person, including a franchised motor vehicle dealer, who is authorized by the manufacturer to service motor vehicles
sections.text: In the case of a recreational vehicle when there are two or more manufacturers, an authorized service agent

sections.heading: Preemption. This chapter preempts any similar county or municipal ordinance regarding consumer warranty rights resulting from the acquisition of a motor vehicle in this state

Fee. (1)A $2 fee shall be collected by a motor vehicle dealer, or by a person engaged in the business of leasing motor vehicles, from the consumer at the consummation of the sale of a motor vehicle or at the time of entry into a lease agreement for a motor vehicle
